_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Our RMP and its plan responsibilities are delegated to those whom are aware and cautious to maintain zero Accidental mishaps. We have lowered to hold as minimal amounts on hand ,strictly only what is on hand in our process tank. We have tanks at ground level with a secondary containment around them in the department to hold double what's being used so In no way could an accidental release make it outside. Our location of the process is far enough removed from the outside that in no way should it ever impact wildlife or human life. In house awareness training in our process is always going on to maintain safety and minimize all risk's. In any event of risk or exposure we work closely with Fire department and a chemical waste removal company that are both trained in emergency response with hazardous chemicals.

Rantec Microwave is an Aerospace manufacture which we chemically plate Aluminum metal for use in conditions not in normal environments.  We have a small team that has been doing this process for a long time and our ongoing training in Haz-Com and site specific chemicals on a yearly basis has geared us to a safety awareness atmosphere. Our plating process is very single lined assembly in nature so very clean and easy. We do have multiple process options for plating material for our customers. The bulk of our facility Metal machines on CNC's and then they are assembled and tested on site after they are chemically plated.



1. Accidental Release prevention and emergency response policies

Rantec Microwave Systems Inc. Is committed to operate in a manner that is safe for our employee's, the community, and the environment. As part of this commitment, Rantec has established a Risk Management Program that helps the company to identify and communicate risks associated with our operations. Reasonable controls have been established to prevent accidental  releases from occurring . In the highly unlikely event of a  release of hazardous materials from the facility , speci

fic plans are in place to reduce the effects upon our employees and the general public. Rantec has developed site- specific plans for emergency response that involve both our employee's and local emergency service providers.



2. Facility and Regulated Chemical Description

In pursuant to S25534 California Health & Safety Code, Rantec is required to prepare and submit a Risk Management Program (RMP) plan due to the onsite process containing regulated chemical above it's threshold quantity.

The regulated process is : Nitric Acid Cleaning Line

Nitric acid, a Cal-Arp regulated toxic substance, is present above it's 1000 pound threshold. Hence, it meets the criteria for the Cal-Arp program level 1.

In addition to Nitric acid, Rantec uses several other chemicals currently not being subject to the RMP regulation.



3. Accidental Release Prevention Program

Rantec is dedicated to continuous improvement on it's environmental, health and safety program. The processing tanks containing nitric acid are equipped with secondary containment.

Rantec's employees are trained, knowledgeable, and skilled which results in a workforce that is very capable in their job performance. Employee's are provided with detailed information concerning their job duties and chemicals onsite,they are experienced in operating the process lines. Employee's are also trained on the facility's Emergency Reporting Procedure.



4. Five Year Accident History

Rantec has established policy that all incidents and near misses with the potential to cause any injury or damages are required to be investigated. Rantec  management is not aware of any releases in the past five years that require reporting under the RMP program.



5. Emergency Response Program

Rantec developed an Emergency Reporting procedure that is coordinated with the Los Angeles County Fire Department. The emergency reporting procedure provides roles and responsibilities, procedures, and corrective measures to be used in the event of an e

mergency that could threaten human health or the environment. Employee's are trained and familiar with the contents of the plan, as well as their roles and responsibilities as specified in the plan. The Emergency Reporting Procedure is reviewed periodically and updated as needed.



6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety

 Rantec works with employees, vendors, and consultants to continually improve the safety of the processes. In the event Rantec management identifies additional measures to further improve the safety of the process, they will be implemented in a timely manner.
